text: The serverless functions in projects for the react CMS part are absolutely horrible to work with. No logs and on every new deployment they break if they arent changed due to the weird caching policy I'm guessing
This seriously needs to be fixed yesterday, don't know how this got out to production

You can make your own custom form and submit the data by using HubSpot forms api <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form>

That way you have full control of the validation before you submit it

If you set up onFormReady a click event listner on the submit button you can do your validation and an e.preventdefault in there.

HubSpot seems to trigger the click event even if someone submits with the enter key
+1 to this. Had the same experience, in the end, I decided to just remove the serverless function from the project and use a "regular" one (as in, not in a project).
very strange, what does your serverless.json file look like?

<@U05CAJG8D98> <@U02CS2Q38QG> are you both using serverless functions inside of a CMS react project directly? I've always used them separately and didn't even realize they could live in the same place. I appreciate you both bringing this up

Well, I tried but I didn't get anywhere so I just decided to use the serverless function outside of projects. But it makes sense if you already have a project to be able to use a serverless function inside it. Just like you can when you develop UI extensions.
ok, good to know. I guess I'll wait to see how these bugs resolve but keep it separate for now. thanks for the info

Yea they work inside projects and its easier to manage the repo that way but they are a mess as they are first meant for extensions and the react cms team isnt doing anything with them, no documentation even
Due to their wierd caching and setup you cant view their logs unless they are linked to an extnension and they fail to build if you do a project uplod without the function changing
Stick to cms serverless for now
